Missing pages for CSSRuleList, also updated the interface page which was entirely different from other interface pages. Spec data PR has already been submitted.

Joe: there was a lengthy note on the interface page, I wasn't sure how necessary this was, though I guess a note that you can only get rules out of this object and not edit them is useful. I left the whole thing for now (just formatted it as a note) but let me know your thoughts.

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

document.createElement more accurately returns an HTMLElement instances. document.createElementNS is needed (unfortunately) for non-HTMLElement types, like SVGElement.

The built-in type definition in TypeScript also returns HTMLElement.

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: document.createElement returns an HTMLElement

items.content_html:
Active Learning
The next step after Project Ideation is to map out a workable learning strategy.
Learning is never an easy activity, whether itâ€™s something new or old. Irrespective of what you are trying to learn, commitment is a key prerequisite to learning actively. If you are not committed, you can be easily distracted.
The same thing applies if you are trying to design your website. Because learning is a process, you need to understand that the curve is steep; that there are highs and lows and sometimes, you will feel like giving up. This is where active learning helps push your forward towards the achievement of your end goal. It also helps keep you on track and you know that with each additional time you spend trying to accomplish your goal, the closer you are.
How then can you learn actively? You must be involved. Basically, that is it. Whether you are reading a written content, like MDN documentation or watching a video tutorial, merely trying to take whatever new information you are exposed to will not help you, you need to participate. You need to try things on your own (put in a list).
If you are learning HTML tables, for instance, after seeing the instructorâ€™s solution, you need to try it on your own and then try to improve on it by adding your own ideas. Letâ€™s say your lecture material has an HTML table with 2 rows and 2 columns, you can implement this first and then go further to implement a table with 3 rows and 2 columns, 5 rows and 7 columns and so on. By so doing, it becomes easier to retain whatever new concepts you have learnt.

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: Adding an Active Learning Section

items.content_html:
This adds docs for the new Object.hasOwn() static method. This is going to be implemented in FF92. See #6717 for more information and docs tracking.

Depends on:

  • BCD is pending FF92 : mdn/browser-compat-data#11548
  • Interactive example: mdn/interactive-examples#1872

I am hoping this can drop without the BCD info, once the interactive example goes in.

@jamiebuilds This is draft for your new feature. It includes both new doc and some tidying of hasOwnProperty. Would appreciate your comments.

Further, there is a doc https://developer.mozilla.org//en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Enumerability_and_ownership_of_properties which I think may also need an update. I THINK this just should have hasOwn mentioned alongside the other method. Does that make sense?
items.title: Object.hasOwn() docs

items.content_html: Let me know if you have any questions. Cheers. ðŸ¥‚
items.title: various typographical changes

items.content_html:
The original equated dimensions with directions. But dimensions are not directions. For example, this clause is incoherent:

"the block dimension is always the direction blocks are displayed"
items.title: added clarity

items.content_html: Also, I've never seen a present participle or a gerund used to signify the name of a categorial concept before. It sounds odd to say "margin collapsing" as if it were such a concept. I may very well be wrong here, since my skills are with English and not with web development.
items.title: updates to the Box Model: margin collapsing

items.content_html:
This is related to #6384.

IMO the current article is confusing. Some of the terms used differ from the CSS specs, and inheritance can be introduced separately after the cascade.

My goal is to reorganize the articles and make the content more in line with the specs.
This is a first draft to get some early feedbacks, since it's my first proper try at writing technical documentation.

I'm also wondering if it would be better to put the selector articles before the cascade.

CONTENT:

  • The Cascade
    • Intro
    • Conflicting rules
      • Order of appearance
      • Specificity
      • Origin and importance
      • Context
    • Understanding the cascade
    • Summary
  • Initial values and inheritance
    • Intro
    • Initial
    • Inherit
    • Unset
    • Revert
    • Inheritable properties - #3622
    • Summary

TODO:

  • Handle redirections
  • Fix links and menu
  • PR for the examples
  • PR for the sidebar
items.title: Rewrite of CSS/Building Blocks/Cascade and inheritance

items.content_html: This section is in need of parallelism. The structure is parallel, but the wording is not. Also, novel terms should really be explained either immediately (which is ideal) or later but with an adjacent parenthetical remark. The original didn't do either.
items.title: added clarity
